ZT2Strings.LOC_STRING: Ungulates Unlimited, an animal conservation group, has agreed to donate a Thomson's gazelle to your zoo if you can acquire three African buffalo within one month. Difficulty: Easy
Acquire three African buffalo within one month.
You have acquired three African buffalo and received a Thomson's gazelle as a reward.

You now have three African buffalo in your zoo. In recognition of your efforts on behalf of hooved herbivorous mammals, Ungulates Unlimited has donated a Thomson's gazelle to your zoo. You will find the gazelle crated near the entrance to your zoo.
You didn't obtain three African buffalo within one month, so you did not receive a free Thomson's gazelle.

A month has passed since Ungulates Unlimited made their donation offer and you still do not have three African buffalo in your zoo. The donation offer has expired, so you will not receive a free Thomson's gazelle.

Your zoo has been contacted by Acme Amusements Inc., a firm that makes animal-themed gift items. Acme is considering donating a gift cart to your zoo, but first they want proof that your park is popular. If you have total attendance of more than 20 guests during your first month of operation, Acme will donate a gift cart to your zoo. Difficulty: Easy
Have total attendance of more than 20 guests during the first month to receive a free gift cart.
More than 20 guests visited your zoo during its first month, so you received a free gift cart.

You're doing well! More than 20 guests have visited your zoo in less than a month! Acme Amusements Inc. is so impressed by your zoo's popularity that they have donated a free gift cart to your zoo. You'll find the gift cart crated near your zoo entrance.
Fewer than 20 guests visited during the first month your zoo was open, so you did not receive a free gift cart.
Your zoo has been open for more than a month, but you still haven't attracted 20 guests, so Acme Amusements Inc. has donated their gift cart to a more popular zoo.

The African Conservation Consortium is devoted to preserving African wildlife. The Consortium has offered your zoo a cash grant of $20,000 if you can breed three different species of African animals within three months. Difficulty: Challenging
Breed three different species of African animals within three months.
You have bred one species of African animal. Breed two more to receive a cash grant.
You have bred two species of African animals. Breed one more to receive a cash grant.
You have bred three species of African animals within three months and received a cash grant.

Congratulations! You successfully bred three different species of African animals within three months. The African Conservation Consortium is so impressed with your achievement that they have awarded you a $20,000 cash grant.
You were unable to breed three species of African animals within three months.
Unfortunately, you were unable to breed three different species of African animals within two three, so you have missed your chance to receive a cash grant from the African Conservation Consortium.

The African Conservation Consortium is impressed with your zoo and has offered you financial assistance. If you can earn $8,000 in donations from African animals during the next month, the consortium will award you $8,000 as a matching grant. Difficulty: Varies
Raise $8,000 in donations from African animals within one month.
You raised $8,000 in donations from African animals and received a matching grant.

Your African animals are a big hit with your guests! You've managed to raise $8,000 in donations from African animals in less than a month. The African Conservation Consortium has awarded you an $8,000 matching grant. Even better, the publicity from the grant has made your zoo slightly more famous.
You were unable to earn $8,000 from African animals within one month.

It's been a month since the African Conservation Consortium made their offer. Sadly, you have not been able to raise $8,000 in donations from African animals and you will not receive the matching grant.

A local business tycoon wants to help bring more African animals to your zoo. If you can breed your Masai giraffe within the next four months, he's offered to donate a pair of white rhinos! Difficulty: Moderate
Breed a Masai giraffe within the next four months to receive a pair of white rhinos.
You bred your Masai giraffe within four months and received a pair of white rhinos as a reward.

Terrific! You've bred your Masai giraffe. In addition to having a newborn to take care of, you have also received a pair of white rhinos as a reward. You will find the white rhinos crated near the entrance to your zoo.
You were unable to breed the Masai giraffe within four months.
You were not able to breed the Masai giraffe within four months, so you will not receive a free pair of white rhinos.
